nodes.documentation:
@title SafeMath
@dev Unsigned math operations with safety checks that revert on error.
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two unsigned integers truncating the quotient, reverts on division by zero.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation:
@dev Divides two unsigned integers and returns the remainder (unsigned integer modulo),
reverts when dividing by zero.
nodes.name: mod
Ownable

nodes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
@return the address of the owner.
nodes.name: owner

nodes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation: @return true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.
nodes.name: isOwner
renounceOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: transferOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@dev Transfers control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: _transferOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@title ERC20 interface
@dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20
nodes.name: IERC20
ReentrancyGuard

nodes.documentation:
@dev Prevents a contract from calling itself, directly or indirectly.
Calling a `nonReentrant` function from another `nonReentrant`
function is not supported. It is possible to prevent this from happening
by making the `nonReentrant` function external, and make it call a
`private` function that does the actual work.
nodes.name: nonReentrant

nodes.documentation:
@title Pausable
@dev Base contract which allows children to implement an emergency stop mechanism.
nodes.name: Pausable

nodes.documentation: @return True if the contract is paused, false otherwise.
nodes.name: paused

nodes.documentation: @dev Modifier to make a function callable only when the contract is not paused.
nodes.name: whenNotPaused

nodes.documentation: @dev Modifier to make a function callable only when the contract is paused.
nodes.name: whenPaused

nodes.documentation: @dev Called by a pauser to pause, triggers stopped state.
nodes.name: pause

nodes.documentation: @dev Called by a pauser to unpause, returns to normal state.
nodes.name: unpause

nodes.documentation:
@title GuiderToken
@dev ERC20 Token
nodes.name: GuiderToken

nodes.documentation: @dev Constructor that gives msg.sender initialSupply of existing tokens.
@return the name of the token.
nodes.name: name

nodes.documentation: @return the symbol of the token.
nodes.name: symbol

nodes.documentation: @return the number of decimals of the token.
nodes.name: decimals

nodes.documentation: @return the initial Supply of the token.
nodes.name: initSupply

nodes.documentation: @dev Total number of tokens in existence
nodes.name: totalSupply
balanceOf
allowance
approve
increaseAllowance
decreaseAllowance
_transfer
_mint
_burn
burn
OwnerTransfer
transfer
transferFrom

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

OwnerTransfer(address,uint256).details: Transfer token for a specified address.onlyOwner

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params.owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params.spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

allowance(address,address).return: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.owner: The address to query the balance of.

balanceOf(address).return: An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

params.value: The amount of tokens to burn.

burn(address,uint256).return: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

constructor.details: Constructor that gives msg.sender initialSupply of existing tokens.

decimals().return: the number of decimals of the token.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Decrease the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when allowed_[_spender] == 0. To decrement allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.subtractedValue: The amount of tokens to decrease the allowance by.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Increase the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when allowed_[_spender] == 0. To increment allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

params.addedValue: The amount of tokens to increase the allowance by.
params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.

initSupply().return: the initial Supply of the token.

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

pause().details: Called by a pauser to pause, triggers stopped state.

paused().return: True if the contract is paused, false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

totalSupply().details: Total number of tokens in existence

transfer(address,uint256).details: Transfer token for a specified address

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfer tokens from one address to another. Note that while this function emits an Approval event, this is not required as per the specification, and other compliant implementations may not emit the event.

params.from: address The address which you want to send tokens from
params.to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params.value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

unpause().details: Called by a pauser to unpause, returns to normal state.

devdoc.title: SafeMath

devdoc.author: Remco Bloemen <remco@2π.com>, Eenae <alexey@mixbytes.io>
devdoc.details: If you mark a function `nonReentrant`, you should also mark it `external`.
devdoc.title: Helps contracts guard against reentrancy attacks.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

constructor.details: The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender account.

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

devdoc.details: The Ownable contract has an owner address, and provides basic authorization control functions, this simplifies the implementation of "user permissions".
devdoc.title: Ownable
